Literature Review: Environmental justice (EJ) is a multifaceted concept that has evolved over the years, encompassing various aspects of social, environmental, and economic inequality. This literature review aims to provide an overview of the current state of EJ activism, its relationship with formal institutions, and its influence on scientific findings. The review will also explore future directions for EJ activists and scholars to consider, including the changing nature of EJ coalitions, fragmentation within EJ and with other fields, the historical roots of environmental injustice, and opportunities for stronger infusion of the EJ lens.
